docs.snippet: Fourteen seamen of the government-owned freighter Algic were found guilty by a jury in Federal court this afternoon under a 147-year-old mutiny statute, on two counts of an indictment charging them with conspiring and endeavoring to revolt against...
docs.lead_paragraph: Fourteen seamen of the government-owned freighter Algic were found guilty by a jury in Federal court this afternoon under a 147-year-old mutiny statute, on two counts of an indictment charging them with conspiring and endeavoring to revolt against the authority of the master of their vessel.

headline.main: 14 of Algic's Crew Convicted of Mutiny; Strike Against Government Ruled Illegal

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Successful in his last appearance, but much too late to save the chess championship of the world which had been his, Dr. Max Euwe of this city won the thirtieth game of his return match with Dr. Alexandre Alekhine of Paris in 40 moves tonight,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Successful in his last appearance, but much too late to save the chess championship of the world which had been his, Dr. Max Euwe of this city won the thirtieth game of his return match with Dr. Alexandre Alekhine of Paris in 40 moves tonight, thereby bringing to a conclusion a contest which began at The Hague on Oct. 5.

headline.main: ALEKHINE RESIGNS IN FINAL CONTEST; Ends Long Chess Series With a Total of 171/2 Points Against Euwe's 121/2
SHIPPING AND MAILS; Ships Which Arrived Yesterday

docs.snippet: The National Maritime Union announced yesterday the setting-up of a committee to solicit funds on a nation-wide scale from seamen and labor groups, with which to finance a defense of the fourteen seamen of the freighter Algie.
docs.lead_paragraph: The National Maritime Union announced yesterday the setting-up of a committee to solicit funds on a nation-wide scale from seamen and labor groups, with which to finance a defense of the fourteen seamen of the freighter Algie.
docs.abstract: threatened action on Queen of Bermuda believed averted

headline.main: FUND DRIVE OPENS TO AID ALGIC CREW; National Maritime Union Sets Up Committee to Solicit for Defense

docs.snippet: Amor Brujo, South American thoroughbred whose racing speed has provoked a controversy through comparison with the best in this country, gets his big test tomorrow in the $10,000 added San Francisco Handicap.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amor Brujo, South American thoroughbred whose racing speed has provoked a controversy through comparison with the best in this country, gets his big test tomorrow in the $10,000 added San Francisco Handicap.

headline.main: AMOR BRUJO FACES COAST TEST TODAY; Joint Favorite With Indian Broom in $10,000 Added Closing-Day Feature

docs.snippet: Whichcee, outstanding 3-yearold gelding owned by Major Austin C. Taylor of Vancouver, B. C., won the $10,000 added San Francisco Handicap at Tanforan today in a sensational upset over the South American favorite, Amor Brujo. The time for the mile and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Whichcee, outstanding 3-yearold gelding owned by Major Austin C. Taylor of Vancouver, B. C., won the $10,000 added San Francisco Handicap at Tanforan today in a sensational upset over the South American favorite, Amor Brujo. The time for the mile and a sixteenth was 1:441-5.

headline.main: WHICHECEE ANNEXES RICH COAS EVENT; Taylor Gelding Wins $10,000 Added Race at Tanforan--Count Atlas Second

docs.snippet: The fourth Pan American anti-tuberculosis conference ended this afternoon when Dr. Hector Orrego, president of the conference, read the conclusions reached after four days of work which included visits to many open-air establishments for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The fourth Pan American anti-tuberculosis conference ended this afternoon when Dr. Hector Orrego, president of the conference, read the conclusions reached after four days of work which included visits to many open-air establishments for the treatment of tuberculosis.

headline.main: MEDICAL CONGRESS ENDS; Anti-Tuberculosis Parley in Chili Closes Sessions
